channel.title: Copy of Digg top 24 hours
channel.description: RSS feed with direct links to popular technology articles. based on superdigg pipe

item.title: [+2332] This dog hasn't missed a single riot in years
item.description: The same dog has been spotted in dozens of riot photos since 2008.

item.title: [+1690] Just 2 Fingers (GIF)
item.description: It's hard enough to find someone who could do this trick using their hands, so to witness someone execute it so flawlessly with the help of only their index fingers is nothing short of ridiculous.

item.title: [+1629] Woman claims she became pregnant after watching porn in 3D
item.description: A white American woman who had a black baby claims she fell pregnant whilst watching a porn movie in 3D.

item.title: [+1074] New York's Skyline over 137 years
[+1064] 25 Ridiculous Lady Gaga Costumes [PICS]
item.description: We can always count on Lady Gaga to wear something outrageous when she does just about anything. In fact, by the time this year ends, we are pretty certain that she already has worn costumes more outrageous than the ones listed here. 'm not complaining because it's entertaining to watch paparazzi photos of her.

item.title: [+1025] California Collects $100 Million In Marijuana Sales Taxes
item.description: Adult use legalization could net the state some $1.4 billion in revenues, according to California's Legislative Analyst's Office, or more than $1.2 billion by California NORML's estimate.

item.title: [+833] Greek Debt Crisis Offers Preview of What Awaits U.S.
item.description: American leaders fiddle as excess borrowing roils financial markets.

item.title: [+815] How to hide your porn
item.description: Let's say you look at porn. (You do.) This fact — not just the porn itself — belongs to you. There's no need for it to be a discoverable part of your digital life, or, god forbid, your digital legacy.

item.title: [+801] How 4Chan Hacked the TIME 100 (Video)
item.description: How did the followers of Internet phenom and 4Chan.org founder "moot" put him on top of the TIME 100 poll in 2009?

item.title: [+736] 7 Enormous and Sprawling Video Game Worlds Compared
item.description: The worlds of GTA3, GTA San Andreas, Elder Scrolls Oblivion, Far Cry 2, World of Warcraft, Burnout Paradise, and Just Cause 2 compared side by side.

item.title: [+688] We are not a Christian nation
item.description: You can either emulate the Taliban… or you can make sure that laws, politics, and government are kept wholly and, I dare say, fundamentally separated from religion. The choice is ours.

item.title: [+666] What Happens When You Deactivate Your Facebook Account
item.description: He took a screenshot of what he saw after clicking the "deactivate my account" link on his account page - and it is pretty far-out.

item.title: [+623] The 12 Best Movie Sequels Ever Made
item.description: There is a little bit of a difference between a sequel that tops its predecessor in terms of quality, and one that is a self-contained stroke of genius. These twelve films on our list fit both qualifications.

item.title: [+594] Why Time Travel Will Never Work
item.description: Sorry, time travel hopefuls. Even if you get it right, someday, it's going to go wrong. Although this would've made a great alternate ending for Bill and Ted's Excellent Adventure.

item.title: [+583] Top Countries Ranked by Internet Speed [Pic]
[+579] AT&T Customers Report Most Dropped Calls, Verizon Least
item.description: In a new survey, AT&T scored highest in customer-reported dropped calls. AT&T also fared badly in terms of the number of customers reporting that they’re “very satisfied” with their wireless service. Verizon had the least number of dropped calls and the highest number of satisfied customers.

item.title: [+538] How Skynet REALLY Starts . . . (Pics)
item.description: Robots are among us. Awesome, creepy, fun stuff...

item.title: [+520] Digg Benefits...Good Stuff (Pic)
item.description: http://jobs.digg.com/ ....great benefits, tea parties and you can even bring your dog to work!

item.title: [+518] Palin: beware the British
item.description: Sarah Palin has fuelled growing anti-British sentiment over the Gulf of Mexico oil rig disaster by saying "foreign" oil companies like BP were not to be trusted.

item.title: [+508] New Bill Strips Any Suspected Terrorist of U.S. Citizenship
item.description: The proposed legislation would authorize the State Department to revoke the citizenship of any U.S. national who provides material support or resources, or to a Foreign Terrorist Organization, or who engages in or supports hostilities against the United States or its allies.
